ygData.subject: RE: Digest Number 222
ygData.msgSnippet: Our pet heal spells are different than normal heals. They dont heal HP, but they heal as a percentage of HP. The first one heals 6%, and the 29 renew bones
ygData.messageBody:
Our pet heal spells are different than normal heals. They dont heal HP, but
they heal as a percentage of HP. The first one heals 6%, and the 29 renew
bones heals 16%. So on a level 1 pet, or a level 49 pet, renew bones will
heal in 6 casts. Mend bones in 16 casts. They dont really wear out as our
pets get more HP :)

Utelr Souldrinker
E Marr

-----Original Message-----
From: Tony B [mailto:tonyb72@...]
Sent: 20 January 2000 06:38
To: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EQ_Necromancer] Digest Number 222


From: "Tony B" <tonyb72@...>

to end the debate, yes, heals work on pets. mages i dont know about, but i
havent heard they *didnt* so i assume they can be healed also.
we have pet heal spells
A. so we can heal our pets (my flair for the obvious)
B. they use less mana since it is a specialized spell (i guess)
i would imagine they would be adding 2 more pet heals, because the final one

comes at L29 i think (renew bones). thats a big gap to 49, and the amount
healed is probably insignificant at higher lvls.

belphenor
